title: bold cursive font
author: inditiger

comments.content:
Seem to be shown under several names:  
Barsoi by Brendel Informatik  
OPTIHusky by CastCraft Software  
Huston by Novel Fonts or by FontBank

Similar: Candy Stripe by Alejandro Paul

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317162056im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ws1_5471.jpg)

Would need more letters to confirm.

I have the Novel Fonts set from about 1994 and it is spelled "Houston". My notes say it is actually Husky Script (Solotype catalog, p.104), as the Opti name suggests. I agree with Dick that this seems to be the answer.

- Mike Yanega

Thank you guys! Thank you for the quick response!  
It must have been difficult to identify the font from just two letters. But this is all I had.  
I am using OPTIHusky for this one.  
Thank you once again!
